page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: "Ramparts" runs through farm ,old Roman defence dyke , called Lexden Dyke on O.S. map . Moat surrounds original Roman fortress where farmhouse now stands .House very old front built 1918, back built before 1830 .Six people live there . The family has lived there 17 years .Own 200 acres of land and shop at Stanway. Employ 2 people part time and 2 fulltime .They own 4 tractors ,1 combine harvester ,3 ploughs ,1 rotovater , 2 seed drills ,1 potato harvester ,7 silo's. Animals = 10 hens freerange ,3 peacocks 5 pea hens and some chicks a few sheep 5 race horses which they race at Higham and Marks Tey Crops barley ,wheat, cattle peas , rape and potatoes harvest barley and wheat late July , cattle peas potatoes August.Sell potatoes to merchant Ashdowm Rawlinson.
